```{python echo=false}
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# Load CSV
df = pd.read_csv("assets/publications.csv", skipinitialspace=True)

# Optional: preview table
df.sort_values(["Year","Publication Type"], ascending=[False, True])

from pandas.api.types import CategoricalDtype

# Define the desired order for publication types
pub_type_order = ["Journal", "Conference", "Magazine", "Presentation", "Poster"]
pub_type_cat = CategoricalDtype(categories=pub_type_order, ordered=True)
df["Publication Type"] = df["Publication Type"].astype(pub_type_cat)

# Count by year and type
counts = df.groupby(["Year","Publication Type"], observed=False).size().reset_index(name="Count")

# Calculate counts for the grid
journal_count = len(df[df["Publication Type"] == "Journal"])
conference_count = len(df[df["Publication Type"] == "Conference"])
magazine_count = len(df[df["Publication Type"] == "Magazine"])
presentations_total = len(df[df["Publication Type"].isin(["Conference", "Poster", "Presentation"])])

# Display the counts grid
from IPython.display import HTML, display

grid_html = f"""
<div class="grid" style="margin: 0.5rem 0;">
  <div class="g-col-3" style="text-align: center;">
    <h1 style="font-size: 3rem; font-weight: bold; color: var(--bs-primary); margin-bottom: 0; line-height: 1;">{journal_count}</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 1rem; margin: 0;">Journal Articles</p>
  </div>
  <div class="g-col-3" style="text-align: center;">
    <h1 style="font-size: 3rem; font-weight: bold; color: var(--bs-primary); margin-bottom: 0; line-height: 1;">{conference_count}</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 1rem; margin: 0;">Conference Papers</p>
  </div>
  <div class="g-col-3" style="text-align: center;">
    <h1 style="font-size: 3rem; font-weight: bold; color: var(--bs-primary); margin-bottom: 0; line-height: 1;">{magazine_count}</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 1rem; margin: 0;">Magazine Columns</p>
  </div>
  <div class="g-col-3" style="text-align: center;">
    <h1 style="font-size: 3rem; font-weight: bold; color: var(--bs-primary); margin-bottom: 0; line-height: 1;">{presentations_total}</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 1rem; margin: 0;">Presentations</p>
  </div>
</div>
"""

display(HTML(grid_html))

# Set custom colors for each publication type
custom_colors = ["#220025", "#80008c", "#a900b9", "#6a346f", "#b558bd"]

# Make chart
fig = px.bar(
  counts,
  x="Year",
  y="Count",
  color="Publication Type",
  color_discrete_sequence=custom_colors,
  category_orders={"Publication Type": pub_type_order},
  barmode="group",
  title="Publications by Year and Type"
)

# Move legend inside the plot
fig.update_layout(
  legend=dict(
    x=0.98,  # Position from left (0-1)
    y=0.98,  # Position from bottom (0-1)
    xanchor='right',
    yanchor='top',
    bgcolor='rgba(255,255,255,0.8)',  # Semi-transparent white background
    bordercolor='rgba(0,0,0,0.2)',
    borderwidth=1
  )
)

# fig.update_layout(width=750, height=400)
fig.show()
```
